救.definition: to save; to assist; to rescue

救世軍.definition: Salvation Army (protestant philanthropic organization founded in London in 1865)

救亡.definition: to save from extinction; to save the nation

救人一命勝造七級浮屠.pinyin: jiu4 ren2 yi1 ming4 sheng4 zao4 qi1 ji2 fu2 tu2
救人一命勝造七級浮屠.definition: saving a life is more meritorious than building a seven-floor pagoda (idiom)

救出.definition: to rescue; to pluck from danger

救助.definition: to help sb in trouble; aid; assistance

救命.definition: to save sb's life; (interj.) Help!; Save me!

救命稻草.definition: (one's) last straw to clutch at; one's last hope

救場.definition: to save the show (for instance by stepping in for an absent actor)

救急不救窮.definition: help the starving but not the poor (idiom)

救援.definition: to save; to support; to help; to assist

救星.definition: savior; liberator; emancipator; knight in shining armor

救死扶傷.definition: to help the dying and heal the injured

救治.definition: to provide critical care (to a patient or a diseased plant)

救濟.definition: emergency relief; to help the needy with cash or goods

救火.definition: to put out a fire; firefighting

救災.definition: to relieve disaster; to help disaster victims

救災救濟司.definition: emergency aid committee (of PRC Ministry of Civil Affairs 民政部)

救焚益薪.definition: add firewood to put out the flames (idiom); fig. ill-advised action that only makes the problem worse; to add fuel to the fire

救生圈.definition: life buoy; life belt; (jocular) flab; spare tire

救生艇甲板.definition: boat deck (upper deck on which lifeboats are stored)

救磚.definition: to unbrick; to restore (an electronic device) to a functional state

救護.definition: to rescue; to administer first aid
